title: (x) Courier-like sans in Tate Etc. magazine - Everson Mono {Angel}
content:
What the font?

I got it from the TATE ETC. mag and I think it has also been used for the book 'Vitamin D' by phaidon.  
http://designarchives.aiga.org/index.html?s1=2|s2=1|eid=2538

Thank you

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tateect.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100916224210/http:/typophile.com/files/tateect.jpg) | 68.25 KB |
author: Cola Zero

comments.content:
Thanks for your reply Edward

I've already seen this one, and some parts seems to have the same DNA, like the S, which is almost the same, but when you have a close look to the details, per example the C, g, t, k, e, ect then you see a difference, but thanks anyway
You're quite right, apologies i was a little hasty

Woooowww!!!

It's a monospace font, so the tate folks did some spacing I guess.

Bud anyway, you made my day.

Thanks alot
